page.title: 18RETIREMENT IN BRAILES
page.content: Our forebears knew well the Brailes of a hundred years ago and it was our wish after a life in the Industrial Midlands to retire to this graceful landscape peopled by kindly country folk. A trait outstanding in Brailes people is their friendliness to each other and to newcomers. Nowhere is this more evident than in the work of the three churches and in the{Feldon {Club}- 'the retireds'very own self- supporting group. Of great import to the retired is the Post Office, a focal point in village life, the monthly issue of the {Feldon News}and the regular deliveries by local tradesmen who bring news from near and far. Finally there is the pleasure of coffee mornings and the entertainment and music given by village societies.
